snippet: President Obama hopes that bipartisan leadership on a new commission led by two of the nation’s pre-eminent election lawyers — Robert Bauer and Ben Ginsberg — will yield results.
abstract: Presidential commission led by pre-eminent election lawyers Robert Bauer and Ben Ginsberg will try to find ways to streamline how Americans vote and reduce long lines that kept thousands of people from voting in 2012 presidential election; two men have long been on opposing sides of legal arguments.
lead_paragraph: President Obama hopes that bipartisan leadership on a new commission led by two of the nation’s pre-eminent election lawyers — Robert Bauer and Ben Ginsberg — will yield results.

headline.seo: Opposing Election Lawyers to Lead Obama Voting Panel
headline.main: Election Opponents Team Up on Panel to Fix Voting System
headline.print_headline: Election Opponents Now on Same Team: Panel to Fix Voting System
